item.title: Schlep blindness in statistics
item.description: This is yet another outstanding post by Paul Graham, this time on “Schlep Blindness”. He talks about how there are great startup ideas that no one considers because they are too much of a “schlep” (a tedious unpleasant task). He talks about how most founders of startups want to put up a clever bit of code they wrote and just watch the money flow in. But of course it doesn’t work like that, you need to advertise, interact with customers, raise money, go out and promote your work, fix bugs at 3am, etc.
